bestBHT.bht: Finding the privacy and rest that He had been seeking throughout the day, Jesus retreated to a mountain to pour out His soul and pray about the extraordinary events that had occurred. From this vantage point, He could observe His disciples on the lake, intercede for them, and choose the perfect moment to reveal Himself to them in a new manifestation of His glory. After bidding farewell to the crowds, Jesus took this uncritical opportunity to seek solitude and communion with God.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Getting that privacy and rest which He had vainly sought during the earlier part of the day."
Opportunity also to pour out His soul in connection with the extraordinary excitement in His favor that evening.
A place whence He might watch the disciples on the lake, pray for them in their extremity, and observe the right time for coming to them, in a new manifestation of His glory, on the sea.
Marvin Vincent: After he had taken leave." (Rev., more correctly)
Unclassical, and used in this sense only in later Greek."
John Gill: He departed into a mountain to pray."
After his disciples were gone, and he had dismissed the people, he went from the desert where he had been, up into a mountain."
Being a retired place, to spend some time in private prayer to God.

bhtAttempts.bht: Finding the privacy and rest that He had been seeking throughout the day, Jesus retreated to a mountain to pour out His soul and pray about the extraordinary events that had occurred. From this vantage point, He could observe His disciples on the lake, intercede for them, and choose the perfect moment to reveal Himself to them in a new manifestation of His glory. After bidding farewell to the crowds, Jesus took this uncritical opportunity to seek solitude and communion with God.

Seeking privacy and rest that had eluded Him earlier, Jesus withdrew to a mountain, a secluded place where He could express His soul during the evening's excitement. From there, Jesus could watch His disciples on the lake, intercede for them, and discern the opportune moment for revealing His glory to them on the sea. After bidding them farewell, Jesus seized this unconventional opening to find solace and engage in intimate communion with God through prayer.

To find the privacy and rest He had searched for in vain earlier, Jesus withdrew to a mountain, a place where He could pour out His soul in prayer regarding the extraordinary excitement that had transpired that evening. It also afforded Him the opportunity to keep watch over His disciples on the lake, intercede for them in their time of need, and choose the perfect moment to manifest His glory by walking on water. After bidding farewell, Jesus took leave and sought seclusion on the mountain to commune with God.

From this serene vantage point, He could observe His disciples on the lake, intercede for them in their time of need, and determine the right moment to reveal His glory by walking on water. After bidding farewell to the crowds, Jesus took leave and sought solitude on the mountain to commune with God.
